modules.description: The module offers operations for managing key-value data, including adding, removing, updating, and querying entries, along with merging and transforming structures. It works with maps featuring IP address-port tuples as keys and generic key-value pairs, enabling efficient traversal and filtering. Specific use cases include network configuration management and IP-based data lookup scenarios.

Provides functions to create and manage DNS transport contexts, including setting nameservers, handling timeouts, and performing DNS queries. Operates with types like context, io_addr, stack, and io-wrapped values for asynchronous operations. Used to establish connections, send and receive DNS messages, and manage network I/O in a non-blocking manner.

Establishes network connections with customizable timeouts and retry logic, handling both hostname resolution and direct IP address attempts. Operates on domain names, IP addresses, and TCP flows, supporting asynchronous DNS resolution and connection management. Enables device-specific connection setup with configurable timers and address family preferences.

Manages DNS communication through context-based operations, enabling setup of nameservers, timeout configurations, and asynchronous query execution. Core types include context, io_addr, stack, and io-wrapped values, supporting non-blocking network I/O and message handling. Functions allow establishing connections, sending DNS requests, and receiving responses efficiently. Example tasks include resolving domain names, configuring custom DNS servers, and managing timed-out queries.

manages key-value data with IP address-port tuples as keys, supporting addition, removal, update, and query operations. It enables efficient traversal, filtering, and transformation of map structures, facilitating network configuration and IP-based data retrieval. Operations include merging multiple maps and applying custom transformations to entries. Examples include dynamically updating routing tables or querying session data based on client IP and port.

Provides functions to manage UDP connections, including listening on ports, handling incoming packets, and sending data with optional source addresses and TTL. Operates on types such as IP addresses, Cstruct.t for packet data, and custom error types. Used to process network traffic, route packets based on destination ports, and send datagrams with controlled network parameters.

The module offers TCP connection management and data transfer operations, including reading, writing, and lifecycle control, with support for buffered and nodelay writes. It works with network flows, IP addresses, ports, and a core type representing connection states. Use cases include building reliable networked applications, handling error-prone data transfers, and managing connection shutdowns gracefully.

Provides pretty-printers for errors, IP addresses, and prefixes. Handles IP layer operations such as demultiplexing incoming packets, sending data with configurable options, and generating pseudoheaders for checksums. Works with IP addresses, prefixes, and connection state, enabling network communication and address management.

Provides logging operations for different severity levels, including message formatting and error handling. Works with log levels, formatted messages, and result types to capture and process errors. Enables structured error recovery with custom formatting and tagging.

Manages network communication through UDP and TCP protocols, handling packet reception, transmission, and connection control. Supports IP address manipulation, error reporting, and packet demultiplexing with operations on Cstruct.t, connection states, and network flows. Enables tasks like routing UDP traffic, establishing reliable TCP sessions, and generating checksums for IP packets. Examples include sending datagrams with specified TTL, reading from buffered TCP streams, and pretty-printing network errors.

Processes DNS queries and constructs responses using immutable data structures. Handles DNS message parsing, compression, and validation, operating on wire-format byte sequences and structured record types. Enables implementation of DNS servers by supporting zone file loading, query resolution, and response generation for specific domains.

Provides logging and network communication capabilities, combining severity-based message handling with low-level protocol operations. It uses log levels, formatted strings, and result types for error tracking, and employs Cstruct.t, IP addresses, and connection states for packet and stream management. Tasks include logging structured errors, sending UDP packets with custom TTL, and establishing TCP connections with error reporting. It supports both asynchronous and synchronous network operations, including checksum generation and packet demultiplexing.
